vignette.name: Circular Object menu
vignette.bodytext: The circular object menu in Max provides a quick and easy way to patch intuitively that replaces and extends the earlier quickref menu. This menu has several sub-menus that provide a means of accessing to help files, reference files, and object Inspectors for an object. It also provides a quick way to discover object the messages and attributes associated with that object, and serves as an aid to Max patching.

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu. As you move your mouse over a segment of the circular menu, a label appears to identify the various menus associated with the object. The number of menus shown depends upon the Max object you have selected
To hide the circular object menu, move your cursor away from the circular object menu and it will disappear.

bluebox.header2: Displaying and using a sectional menu

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.

Move your mouse over a segment of the circular menu, click to display the sectional menu's contents, and drag to the menu item you want to select. When you hover over a menu item, you'll see a description of it appear in the Status Bar in your patcher window. When you release your mouse, the menu activity will be performed.

vignette.bodytext: The circular object consists of six sectional menus:

ul.li: The Object menu gives you access to general information about the selected object.
The Attributes menu lets you discover the attributes associated the the object.
The Prototype menu will provide you with access to prototypes of any user interface object you select.
The Preferences menu lets change the size of the circular menu.
The Connect menu displays information associated with object inlets and outlets.
The Messages menu lets you discover the messages that the selected object knows about and will respond to.

bluebox.header2: Setting the circular object menu size
bluebox.bodytext: If you find it difficult to work with the circular object menu because of its size, you can select a larger version of the menu to aid in your patching life.

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.

Move your mouse over a Preferences segment of the circular menu, click to display the Preferences menu and drag to select the Use Large Wheel menu item. The next time you use the circular object menu, you'll be working with a larger version.

vignette.header1: Finding Out About Objects Using the Circular Object Menu
vignette.bodytext: The circular object menu provides quick and easy ways to find out about an object - its function, the information is receives and sends to and from other Max objects, and the attributes and messages it understands. This information is easily accessible with a couple of clicks and some mousing.

bluebox.header2: Using the circular object menu to find out about an object

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge

Move your mouse over any segment of the circular menu, click to display the sectional menu's contents, and drag to the examine a menu item. When you hover over a menu item, you'll see a description of it appear in the Status Bar in your patcher window.
Choose Inspector from the Object sectional menu and release to open the object's Inspector.
Choose Help from the Object sectional menu to open the object's Help files.
Choose Reference from the Object sectional menu to open the object's Reference pages.

vignette.header1: Max Patching Using the Circular Object Menu
vignette.bodytext: The circular object menu provides some shortcuts for adding messages, inspecting attributes, patching inlets and outlets, and locking objects that you may find useful when patching.

bluebox.header2: Patching from the Object sectional menu

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.

Move your mouse over a Object segment of the circular menu, click to display the sectional menu's contents, and drag to select the Lock menu item. When you release your mouse, the your the object will display a green tinge and will be "locked" in place - you won't be able to move the object from its current position. This can be useful when patching in tight spaces or with a lot of objects.
To unlock the object, click anywhere in the patcher window.

bluebox.header2: Patching from the Messages sectional menu

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.

Move your mouse over a Messages segment of the circular menu, click to display the sectional menu's contents, and drag to the message item you want to select. When you release your mouse, a message box containing the message connected to the left inlet of the Max object will automatically be created, ready for you to complete by typing in any arguments the message may require.

bluebox.header2: Patching from the Attributes sectional menu

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.

Move your mouse over a Attributes segment of the circular menu, click to display the sectional menu's contents, and drag to the attribute you want to select. When you release your mouse, an attrui object containing the name of the attribute and connected to the left inlet of the Max object will automatically be created.

bluebox.header2: Patching from the Prototypes sectional menu

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.

Move your mouse over a Prototypes segment of the circular menu, click to display the sectional menu's contents, and drag to the prototype you want to select. When you release your mouse, the user interface object you have selected will be replaced by the selected prototype for the object.

bluebox.header2: Patching from the Connect sectional menu

ul.li: Click on any Max object to select it and position your cursor on the left edge of the object or the object box to display the circular object menu.
Move your mouse over a Connect segment of the circular menu, click to display a listing of all the inlets and outlets of the object and the type of data they expect.

Drag to select an object inlet or outlet. When you release your mouse, the your cursor will be automatically change into the end point of a patch cord connected to the inlet or outlet you selected, ready to be connected to another Max object.
